title: Sydney Sweeney
content:
{{short description|American actress (born 1997)}}
{{Use American English|date=September 2023}}
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2023}}
{{Infobox person
| name               = Sydney Sweeney
| image              = Sydney Sweeney at Berlinale 2023 (portrait).jpg
| alt                = <!-- descriptive text for use by speech synthesis (text-to-speech) software -->
| caption            = Sweeney in 2023
| birth_name         = Sydney Bernice Sweeney
| birth_date         = {{Birth date and age|1997|09|12}}
| birth_place        = [[Spokane, Washington]], U.S.
| education          = [[University of California, Los Angeles]]
| occupation         = Actress and Producer
| years_active       = 2009–present
| partner            = Jonathan Davino (2018–present; engaged)
| signature          = Sydney Sweeney signature.svg
}}
'''Sydney Bernice Sweeney''' (born September 12, 1997) is an American actress.<ref name=UPI>{{cite news|url= https://www.upi.com/Top_News/2019/09/12/UPI-Almanac-for-Thursday-Sept-12-2019/9881568078426/ |title= UPI Almanac for Thursday, Sept. 12, 2019 |work=[[United Press International]]|date= September 12, 2019|access-date=September 9, 2020 | archive-date= December 5, 2019 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20191205204919/https://www.upi.com/Top_News/2019/09/12/UPI-Almanac-for-Thursday-Sept-12-2019/9881568078426/ |url-status=live|quote=…actor Sydney Sweeney in 1997 (age 22)}}</ref> She is best known for her roles in the [[HBO]] drama series ''[[Euphoria (American TV series)|Euphoria]]'' (2019–present) and the first season of the anthology series ''[[The White Lotus]]'' (2021), which earned her nominations for two [[Primetime Emmy Awards]] in 2022.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Emmy Awards |date=July 12, 2022 |title=Outstanding Supporting Actress In A Drama Series - 2022 |url=https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-drama-series |access-date=July 12, 2022 |website=[[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences|Television Academy]] |archive-date=July 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220712154223/https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-drama-series |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Emmy Awards |date=July 12, 2022 |title=Outstanding Supporting Actress In A Limited Or Anthology Series Or Movie - 2022 |url=https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-miniseries-or-a-movie |access-date=July 12, 2022 |website=[[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences|Television Academy]] |archive-date=September 22, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220922031924/https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-miniseries-or-a-movie |url-status=live }}</ref>

Sweeney first gained attention for appearing in the television series ''[[Everything Sucks!]]'' (2018), ''[[The Handmaid's Tale (TV series)|The Handmaid's Tale]]'' (2018), and the limited series ''[[Sharp Objects (miniseries)|Sharp Objects]]'' (2018). In 2019, she was featured in [[Quentin Tarantino]]'s film ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]'', and in 2023, she gained praise for portraying [[Reality Winner]] in the film ''[[Reality (2023 film)|Reality]]''.

==Early life==
Sydney Bernice Sweeney was born on September 12, 1997, in [[Spokane, Washington]], to Lisa ({{Nee}} Mudd) and Steven Sweeney. Her mother is a former criminal defense lawyer, and her father is a hospitality professional.<ref>{{cite web|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|url=https://variety.com/2023/tv/features/sydney-sweeney-not-typecast-cassie-reality-white-lotus-interview-1235688915/|title=Sydney Sweeney Takes Control: The ‘Euphoria’ Star on ‘Feeling Beat Up’ by Online Rumors and Proving People Wrong in Her Producer Era|last=D'Addario|first=Daniel|date=August 9, 2023|access-date=August 9, 2023|archive-date=August 9, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230809163555/https://variety.com/2023/tv/features/sydney-sweeney-not-typecast-cassie-reality-white-lotus-interview-1235688915/|url-status=live}}</ref> She has one brother.<ref name="chicago" /> Sweeney was raised in northwestern [[Idaho]]<ref>{{cite web|work=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]|url=https://www.elle.com/uk/life-and-culture/culture/a39008740/sydney-sweeney-euphoria-defying-expectations/|title=Sydney Sweeney On Defying Expectations, Ambition And Launching Her Own Production Company|last=Burgum|first=Becky|date=February 8, 2022|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220209082649/https://www.elle.com/uk/life-and-culture/culture/a39008740/sydney-sweeney-euphoria-defying-expectations/|archive-date=February 9, 2022}}</ref> in the state's [[Idaho Panhandle|Panhandle region]] along the Washington border, at a rural lakeside home that her family has inhabited for five generations.<ref name=courier>{{cite news|url=https://heraldcourier.com/article_0a4f88dd-004f-5371-a742-0edad1c3eb9c.html|work=[[Bristol Herald Courier]]|title=Sydney Sweeney's road to stardom 'was not happy'|date=January 24, 2022|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220221041827/https://heraldcourier.com/article_0a4f88dd-004f-5371-a742-0edad1c3eb9c.html|archive-date=February 21, 2022}}</ref> Sweeney stated that she has a "religious family."<ref>{{Cite web |last=Tinnin |first=Drew |date=August 14, 2018 |title=Interview: Sydney Sweeney on ALONG CAME THE DEVIL and UNDER THE SILVER LAKE |url=https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/280867/interview-sydney-sweeney-on-along-came-the-devil-and-under-the-silver-lake/ |access-date=July 29, 2022 |website=[[Dread Central]] |language=en-US |archive-date=July 29, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220729033554/https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/280867/interview-sydney-sweeney-on-along-came-the-devil-and-under-the-silver-lake/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

Sweeney attended [[Saint George's School (Spokane, Washington)|Saint George's School]] in Spokane.<ref name="Spokesman-review 02-03-2020">{{cite news|url=https://www.spokesman.com/stories/2020/feb/03/actress-sydney-sweeney-return-home-to-spokane-for-/|title=Actress Sydney Sweeney returns home to Spokane for fan visit at middle school|first=Emma|last= Epperly|newspaper=[[The Spokesman-Review]]|location=Spokane, Washington|date=February 3, 2020|access-date=September 9, 2020|archive-date=June 27, 2020|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20200627123326/https://www.spokesman.com/stories/2020/feb/03/actress-sydney-sweeney-return-home-to-spokane-for-/|url-status=live}}</ref> She was active in numerous athletics: "I was in every single sport possible", she said. "I was on the [[soccer]] team, the [[baseball]] team, the [[Slalom skiing|snow slalom ski]] team, I was [[wakeboarding]]."<ref name=courier/> Sweeney also studied multiple languages and graduated with top grades.<ref name="Interview with Hollywood reporter">{{Cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-features/sydney-sweeney-fame-emmys-euphoria-the-white-lotus-1235186681/|title=Sydney Sweeney on Fame, Hollywood Fakery and the Pressure of Paying the Bills|last=Rankin|first=Seija|date=July 27, 2022|website=Hollywood Reporter|language=en-US|access-date=July 27, 2022|archive-date=July 27, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220727142756/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-features/sydney-sweeney-fame-emmys-euphoria-the-white-lotus-1235186681/|url-status=live}}</ref> She became interested in acting after auditioning to be an extra in an independent film that was shooting in the Spokane area.<ref name="Spokesman-review 02-03-2020" /> To convince her parents to allow her to pursue acting, she presented them with a five-year [[business plan]].<ref name="coveteur" /> Sweeney began to audition and book commercial acting jobs in [[Seattle]] and [[Portland, Oregon]], where the family temporarily resided, until choosing to relocate to [[Los Angeles, California]], when she was 14 years old.<ref>{{cite interview|last=Sweeney|first=Sydney|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCveID9lSFE|via=[[YouTube]]|series=AOL Build Series|title=Sydney Sweeney Talks About The HBO Series, "Euphoria"|date=June 24, 2019|time=2:30|access-date=January 21, 2022|archive-date=January 21, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220121170955/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCveID9lSFE|url-status=bot: unknown}}</ref>

==Career==

Sweeney began her career as guest star in TV shows such as ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'', ''[[Criminal Minds]]'', ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'' and ''[[Pretty Little Liars]]''.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.bustle.com/p/who-plays-Rue-on-euphoria--sweeney-has-had-a-major-few-years-17998527 |title=You'll Recognize This 'Euphoria' Star From Some Of Your Favorite Shows |last=Grubbs |first=Jefferson |date=June 16, 2019 |magazine=[[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]] |access-date=July 3, 2019 |archive-date=June 17, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190617124555/https://www.bustle.com/p/who-plays-cassie-on-euphoria-sydney-sweeney-has-had-a-major-few-years-17998527 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="variety" />

Sweeney starred as Emaline Addario on the [[Netflix]] series ''[[Everything Sucks!]]'', which revolved around two groups of [[High school (North America)|high school]] students in Oregon in 1996. She then appeared in the [[HBO]] miniseries ''[[Sharp Objects (miniseries)|Sharp Objects]]'', recurring as Alice, a roommate whom [[Amy Adams]]'s character meets at a [[psychiatric hospital|psychiatric facility]].<ref name="thelast" /><ref name="deadline" /> Her character was originally supposed to have a smaller role, but the director kept bringing her in for more scenes.<ref name="harpers" /> For the role, Sweeney studied stories of girls who suffered from [[mental disorder|mental illness]] and [[self-harm]]ing, and visited hospitals who had patients who self-harmed.<ref name="thelast" /><ref name="harpers" /> She filmed ''Everything Sucks!'' and ''Sharp Objects'' concurrently, the former during the week and latter on weekends.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://nylon.com/articles/sharp-objects-sydney-sweeney-interview |title='Sharp Objects' Star Sydney Sweeney Thanks Fans Who Say They "Hate" Her |last=Song |first=Sandar |date=July 9, 2018 |magazine=[[Nylon (magazine)|Nylon]] |access-date=June 25, 2019 |archive-date=June 23, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190623232446/https://nylon.com/articles/sharp-objects-sydney-sweeney-interview |url-status=live }}</ref>

Sweeney had a role in the thriller film ''[[Under the Silver Lake]]'' in 2018.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gillespie|first1=Katherine|url=https://www.papermag.com/sydney-sweeney-cole-sprouse-2645672546.html?rebelltitem=1#rebelltitem1|title="Euphoria" Breakout Sydney Sweeney Shot by Cole Sprouse|work=[[Paper (magazine)|Paper]]|date=April 9, 2020|access-date=September 12, 2020|archive-date=October 15, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201015004956/https://www.papermag.com/sydney-sweeney-cole-sprouse-2645672546.html?rebelltitem=1#rebelltitem1|url-status=live}}</ref> She had a recurring role during the second season of the dystopian drama series ''[[The Handmaid's Tale (TV series)|The Handmaid's Tale]]'' as Eden Spencer, a pious and obedient girl from the totalitarian and theocratic Republic of Gilead.<ref name="variety" /> She also starred as the heroine in the horror film ''Along Came the Devil''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Murray|first1=Noel|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-capsule-along-came-the-devil-review-20180809-story.html|title=Review: Mismatched pieces of exorcism thriller 'Along Came the Devil' don't fit|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=August 9, 2018|access-date=September 12, 2020|archive-date=January 16, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210116161036/https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-capsule-along-came-the-devil-review-20180809-story.html|url-status=live}}</ref> The next year, Sweeney appeared in the drama film ''[[Clementine (2019 film)|Clementine]]'', the coming-of-age film ''[[Big Time Adolescence]]'', and [[Quentin Tarantino]]'s dramedy ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://deadline.com/2017/10/startups-otmara-marrero-sydney-sweeney-clementine-movie-1202182597/ |title='StartUp's Otmara Marrero, Sydney Sweeney & More Cast In 'Clementine' |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |date=October 5, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |access-date=February 20, 2018 |archive-date=February 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210212084632/https://deadline.com/2017/10/startups-otmara-marrero-sydney-sweeney-clementine-movie-1202182597/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://deadline.com/2018/06/pete-davidson-sydney-sweeney-machine-gun-kelly-big-time-adolescence-american-high-1202417478/ |title=Pete Davidson, Sydney Sweeney, Machine Gun Kelly & More Join 'Big Time Adolescence' From American High |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |date=June 26, 2018 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |access-date=June 26, 2018 |archive-date=June 27, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180627033953/https://deadline.com/2018/06/pete-davidson-sydney-sweeney-machine-gun-kelly-big-time-adolescence-american-high-1202417478/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/danny-strong-sydney-sweeney-join-once-a-time-hollywood-1129521 |title=Danny Strong, Sydney Sweeney Join 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' (Exclusive) |last=Galuppo |first=Mia |date=August 27, 2018 |magazine=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |access-date=June 25, 2019 |archive-date=August 28, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180828035848/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/danny-strong-sydney-sweeney-join-once-a-time-hollywood-1129521 |url-status=live }}</ref>

[[File:Sydney Sweeney 2019 by Glenn Francis.jpg|thumb|upright|Sweeney in 2019]]
In June 2019, Sweeney began portraying [[List of Euphoria characters#Cassandra "Cassie" Howard|Cassie Howard]], a teenager with a promiscuous reputation, in the [[HBO]] drama series ''[[Euphoria (American TV series)|Euphoria]].''<ref>{{cite web|last1=Chuba|first1=Kirsten|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/euphoria-star-sydney-sweeney-tackling-teen-pregnancy-abortion-discussions-1227536|title='Euphoria' Star Sydney Sweeney on Tackling Teen Pregnancy, Abortion Discussions|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=July 29, 2019|access-date=September 12, 2020|archive-date=July 30, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190730013116/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/euphoria-star-sydney-sweeney-tackling-teen-pregnancy-abortion-discussions-1227536|url-status=live}}</ref> Her performance received praise, earning a nomination for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series]] in [[74th Primetime Emmy Awards|2022]].<ref>{{Cite web |last1=Moreau |first1=Jordan |last2=Schneider |first2=Michael |date=2022-07-12 |title=Emmys 2022: The Complete Nominations List |url=https://variety.com/2022/tv/awards/emmys-nominations-list-2022-1235313788/ |access-date=2022-08-17 |website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |language=en-US |archive-date=July 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220712160603/https://variety.com/2022/tv/awards/emmys-nominations-list-2022-1235313788/ |url-status=live }}</ref> ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' asserted that role of Cassie "proves that Sweeney’s one hell of a shapeshifter between her deft turns in this, ''The Handmaid’s Tale'', ''Everything Sucks'' and ''Sharp Objects''".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Framke |first=Caroline |date=2019-06-13 |title=TV Review: HBO’s ‘Euphoria’ Starring Zendaya |url=https://variety.com/2019/tv/reviews/euphoria-hbo-review-zendaya-1203235780/ |access-date=2023-06-12 |website=Variety |language=en-US |archive-date=April 12, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200412070742/https://variety.com/2019/tv/reviews/euphoria-hbo-review-zendaya-1203235780/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Her many nude scenes in the series received significant attention, generating discussions about [[nudity in film]] and the [[male gaze]]. Despite this, Sweeney has stated she would not stop doing nude scenes.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/28/entertainment/sydney-sweeney-nude-scenes/index.html |title=Sydney Sweeney ‘won’t stop’ doing nude scenes |access-date=March 27, 2023 |archive-date=March 27, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230327171623/https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/28/entertainment/sydney-sweeney-nude-scenes/index.html |url-status=live |work=CNN |first=Lisa |last=Respers France |date=July 28, 2022}}</ref>

Sweeney is the founder of production company Fifty-Fifty Films, launched in 2020.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nellie Andreeva |date=2020-07-31 |title=Sydney Sweeney To Star In & EP 'Players Table' Series For Jean-Marc Vallée & Nathan Ross As She Launches Production Company |url=https://deadline.com/2020/07/sydney-sweeney-star-ep-the-players-table-series-jean-marc-vallee-nathan-ross-as-she-launches-production-company-fifty-fifty-films-1203000310/ |access-date=2023-02-08 |website=Deadline |archive-date=August 1, 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200801230955/https://deadline.com/2020/07/sydney-sweeney-star-ep-the-players-table-series-jean-marc-vallee-nathan-ross-as-she-launches-production-company-fifty-fifty-films-1203000310/ |url-status=live }}</ref> She starred in the TV film ''[[Nocturne (2020 film)|Nocturne]]'' in 2020.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://deadline.com/2019/09/sydney-sweeney-madison-iseman-nocturne-cast-blumhouse-amazon-studios-movie-1202748475/|title='Nocturne': 'Euphoria's Sydney Sweeney & 'Annabelle 3's Madison Iseman To Star In First Title In Blumhouse TV-Amazon Deal|last=D'Alessandro|first=Anthony|date=September 30, 2019|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|access-date=September 30, 2019|archive-date=December 26, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201226211610/https://deadline.com/2019/09/sydney-sweeney-madison-iseman-nocturne-cast-blumhouse-amazon-studios-movie-1202748475/|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2021, Sweeney appeared in the first season of [[Mike White (filmmaker)|Mike White]]'s anthology black comedy series ''[[The White Lotus]]'',<ref>{{cite web|last1=White|first1=Peter|url=https://deadline.com/2020/10/hbo-the-white-lotus-enlighteneds-mike-white-connie-britton-alexandra-daddario-natasha-rothwell-sydney-sweeney-1234599772/|title='Enlightened's Mike White Sets Limited Social Satire 'The White Lotus' At HBO With Connie Britton, Natasha Rothwell & Sydney Sweeney Among Cast|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=October 19, 2020|access-date=February 15, 2021|archive-date=October 19, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201019200621/https://deadline.com/2020/10/hbo-the-white-lotus-enlighteneds-mike-white-connie-britton-alexandra-daddario-natasha-rothwell-sydney-sweeney-1234599772/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=France |first=Lisa Respers |date=2022-07-28 |title=Sydney Sweeney 'won't stop' doing nude scenes |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/28/entertainment/sydney-sweeney-nude-scenes/index.html |access-date=2023-03-27 |website=CNN |language=en |archive-date=March 27, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230327171623/https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/28/entertainment/sydney-sweeney-nude-scenes/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref> as a sardonic college sophomore,<ref name="CharactersNames">{{cite press release|title=New HBO Limited Series THE WHITE LOTUS From Mike White Debuts July 11|url=https://pressroom.warnermedia.com/us/media-release/new-hbo-limited-series-white-lotus-mike-white-debuts-july-11|work=[[WarnerMedia]]|date=May 10, 2021|access-date=May 10, 2021|archive-date=May 10, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210510204857/https://pressroom.warnermedia.com/us/media-release/new-hbo-limited-series-white-lotus-mike-white-debuts-july-11|url-status=live}}</ref> receiving critical acclaim for the role. For her portrayal of the character, she was nominated for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie]] in [[74th Primetime Emmy Awards|2022]]. Her accomplishments earned her a place on the [[Time 100#Time 100 Next list|''Time'' 100 Next list]] for 2022.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Apatow|first1=Maude|url=https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2022/6213734/sydney-sweeney/|title=Sydney Sweeney|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=September 28, 2022|access-date=October 2, 2022|archive-date=September 30, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220930083008/https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2022/6213734/sydney-sweeney/|url-status=live}}</ref>

In 2023, Sweeney starred as [[Reality Winner]] in [[Tina Satter]]'s thriller drama ''[[Reality (2023 film)|Reality]]'', which premiered at the [[73rd Berlin Film Festival]], where she received critical acclaim for her performance; Steph Green of [[IndieWire]] found the film "inventively mounted and extraordinarily tense" and labelled Sweeney as "the real deal".<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-02-18 |title='Reality' Review: Sydney Sweeney Stuns in Fact-Based Single-Room Whistleblower Thriller |url=https://www.indiewire.com/2023/02/reality-review-sydney-sweeney-1234811450/ |access-date=2023-02-20 |website=IndieWire |archive-date=February 21, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230221232742/https://www.indiewire.com/2023/02/reality-review-sydney-sweeney-1234811450/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Jessica Kiang of ''Variety'' wrote that she played "Winner so convincingly that it’s hard to remember her as the sardonic, pampered teen in ''The White Lotus'', or the nice-girl-turned-nasty in ''Euphoria''".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kiang |first1=Jessica |title='Reality' Review: Sydney Sweeney Is Outstanding as Whistleblower Reality Winner in a Clever, Gripping Docudrama |url=https://variety.com/2023/film/reviews/reality-review-sydney-sweeney-1235520653/ |access-date=February 25, 2023 |work=Variety |date=February 18, 2023 |archive-date=February 21, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230221232041/https://variety.com/2023/film/reviews/reality-review-sydney-sweeney-1235520653/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Sweeney next had a role in the crime thriller ''[[Americana (2023 film)|Americana]]'', which premiered at the [[South by Southwest|South by Southwest Festival]] in 2023.<ref>{{Cite web |last=D'Alessandro |first=Anthony |date=2023-02-24 |title='Americana' Starring Sydney Sweeney, Paul Walter Hauser And Halsey To World Premiere At SXSW |url=https://deadline.com/2023/02/sydney-sweeney-halsey-paul-walter-hauser-americana-sxsw-1235270304/ |access-date=2023-02-24 |website=Deadline |language=en-US |archive-date=February 24, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230224233415/https://deadline.com/2023/02/sydney-sweeney-halsey-paul-walter-hauser-americana-sxsw-1235270304/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Complex |first=Valerie |date=2023-03-18 |title='Americana' Review: Tony Tost Turns The Western Genre Upside Down In Directorial Debut Dramedy Starring Sydney Sweeney & Halsey – SXSW |url=https://deadline.com/2023/03/americana-review-sydney-sweeney-paul-walter-hauser-halsey-tony-tost-1235301698/ |access-date=2023-03-18 |website=Deadline |language=en-US |archive-date=March 18, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230318162310/https://deadline.com/2023/03/americana-review-sydney-sweeney-paul-walter-hauser-halsey-tony-tost-1235301698/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

Sweeney is set to star in the [[superhero film]] ''[[Madame Web (film)|Madame Web]]'', set in the [[Sony's Spider-Man Universe]] (SSU) franchise.<ref name="DD">{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2022/03/euphorias-sydney-sweeney-dakota-johnson-sony-marvel-madame-web-1234980232/|title='Euphoria's Sydney Sweeney To Co-Star Opposite Dakota Johnson In Sony's Marvel Pic 'Madame Web'|date=March 16, 2022|publisher=Deadline|access-date=March 17, 2022|archive-date=March 17, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220317092334/https://deadline.com/2022/03/euphorias-sydney-sweeney-dakota-johnson-sony-marvel-madame-web-1234980232/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="SS">{{Cite web |last=Barraclough |first=Leo |date=April 2, 2022 |title=Sydney Sweeney on Her Favorite 'Euphoria' Meme, Exploring the Dark Side of Cassie and Her Martial Arts Skills |url=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/sydney-sweeney-interview-euphoria-cassie-the-white-lotus-1235221888 |url-status=live |access-date=April 2, 2022 |website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |quote=One of the roles she has lined up is in 'Madame Web', a comic-book tentpole set in [the SSU]. Is she reading the comic books the movie is based on? "I am. I’ve been ordering a bunch of comic books,' she says. 'There’s a lot to learn. I've always been a really big fan of all of the Marvel and Sony Universe movies. I've grown up watching them all and I've been engulfed in the entire world my entire life, so being able to be a part of that is such an incredible, incredible thing.'|archive-date=April 2, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220402215256/https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/sydney-sweeney-interview-euphoria-cassie-the-white-lotus-1235221888/ }}</ref> She will also star with [[Glen Powell]] in the romantic comedy ''[[Anyone but You]]'',<ref name="aby"/> produce and star in the psychological horror film ''[[Immaculate (upcoming film)|Immaculate]]'',<ref name="immaculate"/> and star alongside [[Julianne Moore]] in ''[[Echo Valley (film)|Echo Valley]]''.<ref name="echo"/> In 2023, she was featured in the music video for [[the Rolling Stones]]' single "[[Angry (The Rolling Stones song)|Angry]]", from their ''[[Hackney Diamonds]]'' (2023) album.<ref>{{Cite news |last=McIntosh |first=Steven |last2=Savage |first2=Mark |date=2023-09-06 |title=The Rolling Stones confirm details of new album Hackney Diamonds |language=en-GB |work=BBC News |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-66720789 |access-date=2023-09-06 |archive-date=September 6, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230906134509/https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-66720789 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2023/10/sydney-sweeney-vanessa-kirby-hans-zimmer-join-jude-law-ana-de-armas-ron-howard-eden-movie-australia-1235587009/|title=Vanessa Kirby & Sydney Sweeney Join Jude Law, Ana De Armas & Daniel Brühl In Ron Howard’s Renamed Survival Thriller ‘Eden’ Ahead Of November Shoot; Hans Zimmer To Score For Imagine & AGC — AFM|publisher=Deadline|access-date=October 31, 2023|archive-date=October 30, 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231030152628/https://deadline.com/2023/10/sydney-sweeney-vanessa-kirby-hans-zimmer-join-jude-law-ana-de-armas-ron-howard-eden-movie-australia-1235587009/|url-status=live}}</ref>

==Personal life==
Sweeney is engaged to businessman Jonathan Davino.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-12-19 |title=Sydney Sweeney is the moment |url=https://www.glamourmagazine.co.uk/article/sydney-sweeney-interview-december-2023 |access-date=2023-12-20 |website=Glamour UK |language=en-GB}}</ref>
